pages.title: Wireless Hub
pages.text: The $(item)Logic Link$() can act as a $(thing)wireless hub$(), discovering and controlling nearby LogicLink devices without wired connections.$(br2)The hub scans for Logic Sensors, Creative Logic Motors, Logic Drives, and Redstone Controllers within range (default 64 blocks, max 256).

pages.title: Using the Hub
pages.text: $(bold)Discover devices:$()$(br)$(#4488CC)local link = peripheral.find("logiclink")$(br)local devs = link.getDevices()$(br)for _, d in ipairs(devs) do$(br)  print(d.id .. " " .. d.type)$(br)end$()$(br2)Devices get auto-IDs like $(thing)sensor_0$(), $(thing)motor_1$(). You can set labels:$(br)$(#4488CC)link.setDeviceLabel("sensor_0", "Furnace")$()

pages.title: Remote Control
pages.text: Control any device in range through the hub:$(br2)$(bold)Remote Motor:$()$(br)$(#4488CC)link.setRemoteSpeed("motor_0", 128)$(br)link.enableRemote("motor_0", true)$()$(br2)$(bold)Remote Sensor:$()$(br)$(#4488CC)local data = link.getRemoteSensorData("sensor_0")$(br)print(data.data.speed)$()$(br2)$(bold)Remote Redstone:$()$(br)$(#4488CC)link.setRemoteRedstoneOutput("rc_0", "minecraft:redstone", "minecraft:redstone", 15)$()
